description: From dyad +â€Ž -ic. The mathematics sense was coined by Josiah Willard Gibbs in 1884 in the second half of his book Elements of Vector Analysis.

adjectives.description: dyadic (comparative more dyadic, superlative most dyadic)

definitionGroups.group: Pertaining to a dyad, the number two; of two parts or elements.

entries.meaning: (mathematics) having an arity of two (taking two arguments or operands)
Pertaining to the physical sex of a person who is exactly male or female in genetics, anatomy and hormone levels; not intersex.
(mathematics) The sum of two or more dyads
